Cherrycake\Items

Class that provides a way to retrieve, count and treat multiple items based on an App implementation of the get method

    Synopsis

    Hierarchy

    Extends

    Implements

    • Iterator

    Tasks

    Line Task
    16+ Check the caching and the cache clearing performed by the fillFromParameters, clearCache and buildCacheKeyNamingOptions methods

    Members

    private

    • $items — array
    • $totalNumberOf — integer

    protected

    • $cacheProviderName — string
    • $cacheTtl — integer
    • $cachedKeysPoolName — string
      The CachedKeysPool mechanism allows for the wiping of multiple cached queries at once that are related to the same Items set.
    • $databaseProviderName — string
    • $isCache — boolean
    • $itemClassName — string
    • $tableName — string

    Methods

    public

    • __construct() — Constructor, allows to create an instance object which automatically fills itself in one of the available forms
    • addCachedKey() — Adds the given cache key to the pool of cached keys.
    • addItem() — Ads an Item to the list with the given key if specified
    • buildCacheKeyNamingOptions() — Builds a suitable cacheKeyNamingOptions array for performing queries and also clearing cache. Takes the same parameters as the fillFromParameters method. Intended to be overloaded.
    • clearCache() — Clears the cache for the query represented by the given $p parameters, just as they were passed to buildCacheKeyNamingOptions (most probably passed first to fillFromParameters)
    • clearCachedKeysPool() — When using the CachedKeysPool mechanism, this method removes all the cache entries corresponding to each stored key from cache, effectively clearing all the cached queries related to this Items object.
    • count()
    • current()
    • fillFromArray() — Fills the list with the given arrays
    • fillFromDatabaseResult() — Fills the list with Items loaded from the given DatabaseResult object
    • fillFromParameters() — Fills the list with items loaded according to the given parameters. Intended to be overloaded and called from a parent class.
    • filter() — Filters the items using the passed function.
    • find() — Finds the item with the given key
    • getItemClassName() — Determines the Item class name that has to be created. When using a DatabaseRow, the DatabaseRow is passed as an argument to help determine the class name if needed. This is intended to be overloaded when different Item classes must be used depending on the specific implementation. If not overloaded, it just uses $this->itemClassName
    • isAny()
    • isExists() — Checks whether the Item with the given key exists on the list
    • key()
    • next()
    • prev()
    • remove() — Removes the Item with the given key from the list
    • rewind()
    • valid()

    Inherited from Cherrycake\BasicObject

    public

    • build() — Creates an object and returns it
    • setProperties() — Bulk sets the given properties for this object
    • treatParameters() — Provides a system to pass complex parameters to a method, where parameters are passed in a hash array instead of the usual parameters passing method. A method using this system should accept a hash array of parameters and pass them as the first parameter to this method via a parent::treatParameters call, specifying as a second parameter a setup hash array of options for each parameter to be treated in a special way.
